intro: Calycogonium hispidulum, commonly known as the hairy calycogonium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds. It is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
